direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve creating requests/responses related to connection management, specifically handling peer addresses and transaction IDs.
Both methods create responses that involve setting message types and adding specific attributes like XOR-MAPPED-ADDRESS, sharing similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods handle the creation of responses that involve managing network resources and addresses, albeit for different purposes (connect vs. allocation).
Both methods involve creating error responses with specific error codes and handling potential exceptions, which can be tested for similar exception scenarios.
Both methods are part of the same class and handle responses related to network operations, suggesting a dependency on shared underlying services or states.
